name: Grilled Chicken Salad
description: Fresh greens topped with grilled chicken, colorful vegetables, and homemade dressing. Satisfying and healthy main course salad.

instructions.instruction: Remove chicken from fridge 15 minutes before cooking. Room temperature ensures even cooking.
Make marinade: Combine 2 tbsp olive oil, oregano, half the salt and pepper.
Place chicken between plastic wrap and pound to even thickness (about 2cm).
Coat chicken with marinade. Let sit at least 10 minutes.
instructions.tip: Longer marinating = better flavor. Can marinate up to 2 hours in fridge.

instructions.instruction: Heat grill pan or outdoor grill to medium-high heat.

instructions.tip: Don't flip frequently - wait for nice grill marks.

instructions.instruction: Chicken is done when internal temp reaches 165Â°F. Check with thermometer.
Transfer chicken to cutting board. Rest 5 minutes.
Make dressing: Shake or whisk remaining 2 tbsp olive oil, lemon juice, honey, mustard, garlic, and remaining salt/pepper in jar.
Place mixed greens in large serving bowl.
Arrange cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and corn on top.
Slice avocado and place on salad.
instructions.tip: Slice at last minute - avocado browns quickly.

instructions.instruction: Arrange chicken slices on top of salad.
Drizzle dressing over salad and serve immediately.
instructions.tip: Dressing can be served on the side - everyone uses what they want.

tips: Chicken breast is one of the leanest protein sources.
Avocado adds healthy fats and fiber.
Chicken can be prepped ahead and stored in fridge - meal prep friendly.
Dressing keeps 1 week separately in fridge.
Can also be served warm in winter.
storageInfo: Store dressing and chicken separately, refrigerate 3 days. Add avocado fresh.
servingSuggestion: Serve as complete meal on its own, or with crusty bread on the side.
variations: Caesar style: Add croutons and parmesan, use Caesar dressing.
Greek style: Add feta cheese, olives, and capers.
Southwest: Add black beans, corn, and ranch dressing.
Asian style: Add sesame dressing, edamame, and mandarin slices.
